findings.title: MOEE - Misleading Ownership Event Emission
findings.description: The contract emits an OwnershipTransferred event with misleading parameters when transferOwnership, renounceOwnership, and lockOwnership methods are called, potentially leading to misinterpretation of ownership status.

findings.title: MEE - Missing Events Emission
findings.description: The contract performs actions and state mutations from external methods that do not result in the emission of events.

findings.title: CR - Code Repetition
findings.description: The contract contains redundancy in the implementation of the transfer and transferFrom methods, which can increase codebase size and introduce potential inconsistencies or errors.

findings.title: IDI - Immutable Declaration Improvement
findings.description: The contract declares state variables that are initialized once in the constructor and are not modified afterwards, which can be optimized by declaring them as immutable to reduce storage and computation required by the contract.

findings.title: L04 - Conformance to Solidity Naming Conventions
findings.description: The code does not conform to Solidity naming conventions, which can affect readability and maintainability.

findings.title: L19 - Stable Compiler Version
findings.description: The `^` symbol indicates that any version of Solidity that is compatible with the specified version (i.e., any version that is a higher minor or patch version) can be used to compile the contract. The version lock is a mechanism that allows the author to specify a minimum version of the Solidity compiler that must be used to compile the contract code.
